creator: davide@onlyforfun.net
text:
On a vanilla installation of Solaris _without_ DNS enabled, the gethostbyname()
fails in handling 255.255.255.255 as a valid address. As a result the
apr_sockaddr_info_get() return an error and Apache crashes at startupt
blaming vhost.c.

Workaround: use a DNS or _not_ use the _default_ flag in the VirtualHosts.

creator: trawick@apache.org
text:
Thanks for figuring out that this is based on whether or not DNS is enabled ;)

Probably APR should make a lookup of this work regardless of whether or not the
underlying platform can handle it (it already does for non-getaddrinfo() boxes I
think).

I had this problem on a production server (Sun V280, SunOS 5.8). After figuring 
out that it was linked to the _default_ VHOST, I reproduced the problem on a 
test server by modifying the resolver configuration in nsswitch.conf ("hosts: 
files" instead of "hosts: files dns"). After having replaced _default_ by an IP 
address, the server started normally. 

I then tried to apply the same fix to the production server, replacing 
_default_ by an IP address, but without any luck; it still coredumped.

Therefore, I wonder if there could be something more to it than just the 
resolution of 255.255.255.255...
